etymologies: early 20th century. From scientific Latin Rhinosporidium, genus name + -osis

definitions: Chronic infection of the nasal cavities or other parts of the body by the organism Rhinosporidium seeberi, occurring in humans and domestic animals, especially in South Asia and tropical America, and typically producing polypoid lesions.

notes.text: Organisms of the genus Rhinosporidium have been variously regarded as protozoans and fungi, but are now usually placed in a group of protists allied to both animals and fungi.
